column2: Daigaku-ryo was the former Imperial university of Japan, founded at the end of the 7th century. The Daigaku-ryo predates the Heian period, continuing in various forms through the early Meiji period.

Todai-ji is a Buddhist temple complex that was once one of the powerful Seven Great Temples, located in the city of Nara. Its Great Buddha Hall houses the world's largest bronze statue of the Buddha Vairocana.
Nanchan Temple is a Buddhist temple built in 782 during China's Tang dynasty, and its Great Buddha Hall is currently China's oldest preserved timber building extant.

The Guozijian, sometimes translated as the Imperial College, was the national central institution of higher learning in Chinese dynasties after the Sui dynasty. It was the highest institution of academic research and learning in China's traditional educational system, with the function of administration of education.
The Gukhak, was the sole recorded institution of higher learning in the Silla period of medieval Korean history.
Borobudur is a 9th-century Mahayana Buddhist temple in Magelang Regency, not far from the town of Muntilan, in Central Java, Indonesia. It is the world's largest Buddhist temple.
Tibetans, in general, consider this temple as the most sacred and important temple in Tibet.
The Shwedagon is the most sacred Buddhist pagoda in Myanmar, as it is believed to contain relics of the four previous Buddhas of the present kalpa.
More than 10,000 Buddhist temples, pagodas and monasteries were constructed in the Bagan plains, of which the remains of over 2200 temples and pagodas survive.
Haeinsa is one of the Three Jewels Temples, and represents Dharma or the Buddha's teachings.
Its massive mandala makes it one of the largest spherical stupas in Nepal and the world.
Vishnupad is an ancient Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu

Prambanan is a 9th-century Hindu temple compound in Special Region of Yogyakarta, Indonesia, dedicated to the Trimurti, the expression of God as the Creator (Brahma), the Preserver (Vishnu) and the Destroyer (Shiva).

The original monuments of this 11th-century temple were built around a moat. It included gopura, the main temple, its massive tower, inscriptions, frescoes, and sculptures predominantly related to Shaivism, but also of Vaishnavism and Shaktism.
Dedicated to the Hindu Sun God Surya, what remains of the temple complex has the appearance of a 100-foot (30 m) high chariot with immense wheels and horses, all carved from stone
It is one of the largest rock-cut Hindu temple cave complexes in the world, with artwork dating from the period between 600 and 1000 CE.
Historical records note that the Khajuraho temple site had 85 temples by the 12th century, spread over 20 square kilometers.
Qutb Minar is a minaret and "victory tower" that forms part of the Qutb complex, which lies at the site of Delhi’s oldest fortified city, Lal Kot, founded by the Tomar Rajputs.

Originally constructed as a Hindu temple dedicated to the god Vishnu for the Khmer Empire by King Suryavarman II, it was gradually transformed into a Buddhist temple towards the end of the 12th century
The Temple of Confucius in Qufu, Shandong Province, is the largest and most renowned temple of Confucius in East Asia.
These caves contain some of the finest examples of Buddhist art spanning a period of 1000 years.
Leshan's Giant Buddha is a 71-metre (233 ft) tall stone statue built between 713 and 803 (during the Tang dynasty).
Van Mieu or Temple of Literature is a temple dedicated to Confucius in Hanoi, northern Vietnam.
Qing Yang Gong was said to be the birthplace of the founder of Taoism, Laozi, and is where he made the first sermon about Taoism.
Chang'an was home to countless generations of several chinese dynasties acummulating vast palaces such as Taiji, Daming and Weiyang.
The Great Shangqing Palace was a taoist temple built during China's Song Dynasty, which lasted from 960 to 1279.
My Son is a cluster of Hindu temples in central Vietnam, constructed between the 4th and the 14th century by the Kings of Champa.

Travellers to 'The Western Regions' left China through the famous Yumenguan, or Jade Gate Frontier-post, named for the many jade caravans that passed through it. The original Jade Gate was erected by Emperor Wudi soon after 121 BCE and was abandoned around the 6th century CE.

column2: Monte Alban is a very visible site located at the center of the valley of Oaxaca. It was the capital of a large polity with regional projection and at its height was listed as one of the mos popolous in mesoamerica.
Tula is affirmed to be the site of the original Tula. The God Quetzalcoatl was one of its kings but just like him what is know about the city is grounded in legend and speculation.

The capital of the famous Aztec Empire became the largest and most popolous city in the entirity continent. Of the original city little has remained unchanged due to the expansion of Mexico City and spanish vandalism. It had retractable bridges conections to the mainland, floating city extensions, aqueducts, temples and palaces.

The astounding ruins of Cholula are home to the, by far, pyramid with the largest base in the entire world. Dedicated to the god Quetzalcoatl the grand structure's base measures 300 by 315 metres. For comparison the Great Pyramid of Giza falls short at 230.3 by 230.3 metres.
Lyobaa or Mitla was a later Zapotek site. It is know for its mosaics perfectly fitted together without recourse to mortar and its preference for confort instead of monomental architecture.
At its height it was one of the most diversily populated settlements in the Maya region and its achitecture reflects that. Later on it was described as a Tula or metropolis.

The Tariaran is a characteristic cerimonial center consisting of 5 rounded pyramids mounted on a large platform where religious rites including human sacrifice by burning would take place before going of to war.
Tikal came to dominate much of the Maya region and maintained a close contact with Teotihuacan first through diplomacy and then through the instalation of Yax Nuun Ahiin I on the cities throne

The state of Chiapas is home to not one, but several maya sites of imense historical importance spaning the entirity of its existence. Palenqu, Yaxchilan, Tonina, Chinkultic, Bonampak, Izapa, Tenam Puente, Lagartero, Junchavin, Chiapa de Corzo and Plan de Ayutla

Teotihuacan was the greates city of its time in the entirity of America, being one of the cities called Tula which in a non literal sense means metropolis it is home to the tallest and third tallest pyramids in America. The people that built it, the very city, its political reach not excluding the possibility of it being the capital of a lost empire empire, and the reasons for its abandonment are obscured in mistery and lost to the sands of time.
The Xochicalco complex was founded by Mayan speaking traders settling in the Texcoco Valley but shows traces from all surrounding cultures. Its rise is associated with the fall of Teotihuacan.

The creation of this vast and impressive complex is atributed, with some uncertanty, to the Totonac or the Huastec cultures and boasts a unique architectonical direction in Mesoamerica featuring namelly pyramids with holes.
